UI - core widgets¶

class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MT2DSlider(**kwargs)¶

MT2DSlider is an implementation of a 2D slider using MTWidget.

Parameters:
min_x : int, default is 20

Minimum value of slider

max_x : int, default is 100

Maximum value of slider

min_y : int, default is 20

Minimum value of slider

max_y : int, default is 100

Maximum value of slider

radius : int, default is 200

Radius of the slider handle

value_x : int, default is min_x

Default X value of slider

value_y : int, default is min_y

Default Y value of slider
draw()¶
get_value_x()¶
get_value_y()¶
on_touch_down(touches, touchID, x, y)¶
on_touch_move(touches, touchID, x, y)¶
on_touch_up(touches, touchID, x, y)¶
on_value_change(value_x, value_y)¶
set_value_x(value)¶
set_value_y(value)¶
value_x¶
Value of the slider (x axis)
value_y¶
Value of the slider (y axis)
class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MTButton(**kwargs)¶

MTButton is a button implementation using MTWidget

Parameters:
label : string, default is ‘’

Label of button

color_down : list, default is (.5, .5, .5, .5)

Color of button when pushed

anchor_x: string

X anchor of label, refer to pyglet.label.anchor_x documentation

anchor_y: string

Y anchor of label, refer to pyglet.label.anchor_x documentation

font_size: integer, default is 10

Font size of label

bold: bool, default is True

Font bold of label

border_radius: float, default is 0

Radius of background border
draw()¶

get_state()¶
label¶
on_press(touchID, x, y)¶
on_release(touchID, x, y)¶
on_resize(w, h)¶
on_touch_down(touches, touchID, x, y)¶
on_touch_move(touches, touchID, x, y)¶
on_touch_up(touches, touchID, x, y)¶
set_label(text)¶
set_state(state)¶
state¶
Sets the state of the button, “normal” or “down”
class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MTButtonMatrix(**kwargs)¶

ButtonMatrix is a lightweight Grid of buttons/tiles collide_point returns which matrix element was hit draw_tile(i,j) draws the tile @ matrix position (i,j)

collide_point(x, y)¶
draw()¶
draw_tile(i, j)¶

class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MTColorPicker(**kwargs)¶

MTColorPicker is a implementation of a color picker using MTWidget

Parameters:
min : int, default is 0

Minimum value of slider

max : int, default is 255

Maximum value of slider

targets : list, default is []

List of widget to be affected by change

class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MTImageButton(**kwargs)¶

MTImageButton is a enhanced MTButton that draw an image instead of a text.

Parameters:
filename : str

Filename of image

scale : float, default is 1.0

Scaling of image, default is 100%, ie 1.0

class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MTScatterPlane(**kwargs)¶

A Plane that transforms for zoom/rotate/pan. if none of the childwidgets handles the input (the background is touched), all of tehm are transformed together

draw()¶

class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MTScatterWidget(**kwargs)¶

MTScatterWidget is a scatter widget based on MTWidget

Parameters:
rotation : float, default to 0.0

Set initial rotation of widget

translation : list, default to (0,0)

Set the initial translation of widget

scale : float, default to 1.0

Set the initial scaling of widget

do_rotation : boolean, default to True

Set to False for disabling rotation

do_translation : boolean or list, default to True

Set to False for disabling translation, and [‘x’], [‘y’] for limit translation only on x or y

do_scale : boolean, default to True

Set to False for disabling scale
apply_angle_scale_trans(angle, scale, trans, point)¶
collide_point(x, y)¶
draw()¶
find_second_touch(touchID)¶
get_scale_factor()¶
init_transform(pos, angle, scale)¶

to_local(x, y)¶
to_parent(x, y)¶
class pymt.ui.widgets.ui.MTSlider(**kwargs)¶

MTSlider is an implementation of a scrollbar using MTWidget.

Parameters:
min : int, default is 0

Minimum value of slider

max : int, default is 100

Maximum value of slider

orientation : str, default is vertical

Type of orientation, can be ‘horizontal’ or ‘vertical’

value : int, default is min

Default value of slider
